reviews.review_msg:
there wasnt an option for esr100 so i selected wtv
she's one of the nicest and most helpful profs i've ever met. she's very passionate about what she's teaching. just make sure to complete the weekly assignments and participate in class its an easy A from there

Very specific with instructions, but is more chill in person than on paper (criteria, syllabus, etc.). She lowers the total points of each exam to raise people's grades. Make flashcards during lectures. Try to do both tb readings and lecture content review. Use critical thinking during exams b/c they may have questions you've never seen before.

Chill prof
Yes, you'll probably want to attend the classes to scoop up a participation grade.
Just keep up with her slides weekly and you'll be fine (as you can tell I didn't).
There are also weekly assignments which can be a bit of a pain but it's good practice.
Group projects are unnecessary imo but they do exist and there's 2 of them.
Eva is a super nice lady, always caring, anything happens, go talk to her, she can always give you the best solution. Take ling111 before this, it will help. Note taking course. Has two group work.

Unless you THOROUGHLY enjoy the topic of ling I'd recommend you avoid this class, cause it's mind numbing. On exam days, we would STILL be learning info (it was not on the same exam) but still made the day so much longer. The prof was nice & you can tell she is passionate about ling but it's not a gpa booster and there are group projects which suck

a sweetheart. inspirational. kind. funny. i love her. i wish her nothing but peace, fun and whimsy. but holy moly, don't take this course if you don't need it. run for the hills, my fellow english majors. you will learn you NOTHING about english. you will be humbled. you will experience fear. you WILL struggle. a verb is not what you think it is.

Eva is the sweetest prof I've met at SFU. She deeply cares about the education of her students and makes an effort to memorize everybodies names. Her examples of the topics really helps to understand the material. Two group projects that were a bit difficult but it was nothing crazy. Her exams are definitly challaning.

She is a super nice person who cares about her students but, does not realize the sheer amount of work all her projects and assignments require. Attendance is mandatory but, you will learn nothing in class so it seems like a big waste of time. All her projects are extremely tedious which she marks extremely harshly.

Kind engaging professor. Wouldnt take this class if you dont need to though. Got the worst grade Ive ever gotten at SFU. Hard exams. Dont really like the "no email policy about schoolwork"... I understand it takes longer to explain concepts on email, yet a lot of us are commuters who dont have time to drive up the mountain for a simple question.
She is really helpful and caring, BUT i would say her exams are really TOUGH !! ;(  our class average is like D+, if y'all love grammar structures, u guys can take this course

Ivelina is literally the best prof that I have ever met at SFU. She is very interested in what she is teaching and she absolutely loves teaching. The compliments that she gives to the class are also worth noting, it really raises the mood. 
She is also willing to discuss any linguistics topic beyond lectures for HOURS if you have the need.

super sweet instructor, always patient and provide clear explanation
the tests were bit tricky though

Didn't love the online format of this course, partway through it started to get messy. In person office hours with Eva was wonderful however, super sweet and clear explanations. Would definitely take more courses with her in person

She is probably the best teacher I have ever met. First off, she is a very caring a loving person, which makes me more inspired to be working hard in this class. She is willing to explain things over and over, to make sure we understand her course materials. Yes, her exams are hard, but it's not impossible to get a good grade if you just study.

Eva is a really nice prof imo - the textbook was allowed for exams and she's lays out her expectations with todo lists. Theres weekly assignments and 2 group projects which aren't awful. Make sure you stay on top of your readings because the material is accumulative + its easy to fall behind. Overall an ok course if u stay on top of yourself

Weekly group work for attendance & participation grade. 2 group projects (20% of total grade), and if you get a bad group, you are pretty much doomed. Barely anyone in the class understood anything and class exam average was always around 50-55%. Hard to understand lectures. Textbook (which is written by Eva) was not helpful.

Worst Prof I have ever had at UFV. She excepts you to take tests with sentences that are 10 times the length of what is in the lectures and denies the use of class notes in open book tests. Her format is also all over the place. I do not recommend her.

This course was stressful. She had like 2 group projects and if you get a bad group, you already lose the prospect of getting an A. Eva is one of the nicest professors and she gets along well with the students but her classes are long and boring. If you take this course, get ready to really focus in class!

Utter disaster. The only saving grace was the fact that Eva is kind and likes to get to know the students. The course is boring and stressful. She has a lot of group work so if you don't have a good group, you won't get a good grade. Her grade boundaries are extremely high (95% + for an A+). Terrible choice unless you like Linguistics.

Okay prof with procrastination. Eva usually uploads and updates weekly content later than what was said. Eva will explain anything you asked clearly but she gives harder exams (long sentences) compared to lectures and homework. She is responsible and you can learn a lot from her. Good option overall.
good teacher

Eva cares for her students and she is really a sweetheart! She has a PhD and she knows a lot about linguistics. I like Eva so much and I decide to take her other linguistics courses. However, she is not the best professor I've ever met at least in my first semester. She could have taught more clearly though. Linguistics is hard anyway.
Patient teacher, nice temper makes her lectures more relaxing. The lecture content is not as difficult, would be a great choice if anyone is trying to transfer to university.

Eva is a very kind and helpful professor. She is very knowledgeable on English grammar. Be fully prepared before each midterm. Read the textbook frequently and have a good command on each point. If you do not work hard , this course will be somewhat tough for you. It is not easy to get A

Eva is a very passionate linguistics professor. The course content is super interesting too! Make sure you read the textbook because there will be questions from the textbook on the exams. The only thing I wasn't the biggest fan of was the 3 hour lectures, she would talk the entire 3 hours. The course is not difficult if you put in some effort

Lectures were dry and slow to progress through the material, which was sometimes covered ad nauseum. Exams were tricky, but manageable. I enjoyed both of the textbooksthe material interested me. As far as I could tell, she is a fair marker. The practice exams were useful, helped clarify what would be tested. She is also clear in her expectations.
Best prof ever
exams are WAY harder than the practice exams and homework she gave out, literally half of the class are seeking help outside the class.

if her exams are base on homework and practice, you will be fine. I take the same class with her again this term, the exams are easier than the last term and she gives bonus points to improve your grade. hope she can keep on this. if you want higher participation grade, answer the qs she gives on the class
Notes are poorly organized, exams are too hard, and lecture is extremely boring

Eva is such a sweet and caring woman, however, I didn't find her to be a great prof. Her lecture notes were unorganized and hard to follow. Exams were extremely difficult and much harder than any of our practice exams, homework assignments and quizzes. This course was almost entirely exam based as the weekly homework didn't count for marks.

She is super caring of her students. She always tries to make the students happy whether it succeeds or not, still I respect that. She tries her best in delivering the lecture but your self study might matter a lot.
Exams are way harder than practice exams and participation quizs.

The exams are unfair because Iva makes the homework really easy and then the exam is nothing like the homework. She is not clear and doesn't explain things well. She is nice but she rushes too much. Take this course with ANYONE else. I wish another professor was teaching because I like grammar.
Best teacher ever
she's a real sweetheart. her exams are hard but she's helpful and accessible. truly an inspiration. I'll definitely take her course again
Lectures are very boring, waaaay too much reading from the textbook, lectures dont line up with exams, she lectures information right before each exam (day of) that isnt on the exam

She is a nice professor, but her class and exam are not. She uses textbooks a lot. She takes attendance at very beginning of class. The questions in the textbook are totally different from the exam. But, she will give the sample exam questions. I think her exam sentences come from the news, article or journal.

She is really fascinating and amazing prof! She uses the textbooks a lot, but I use them only for homework. You don't need to read the textbooks. You just need to do the homework and review her PPT and you can easily get an A.
Pay attention during the class and do the homework from textbook. Get ready to memorize, but it's not that heavy. Overall is good.
Exams are hard to get a good mark and you need understand the grammar rule to analyze sentences

Nicest, most helpful prof I've ever had! Lectures are quite interesting and the textbook is relevant. Really helps you to understand the material and to get to know her students.  Exams are cumulative but focus mainly on the month before the exam; she's very helpful with exam prep. You really should take a course with her, she is an amazing prof!
Very nice and helpful prof. Tells you exactly what to expect on the test. Only problem is the amount of articles you have to read and 3 cumulative exams. Otherwise, very easy course and great prof

Omg. She is so nice and will tell you exactly what's on the exam because she WANTS you to do well. She is the nicest teacher ever! She makes the exams doable - the kind that you can actually do really well on if you just review a little.
Super easy class. Material is very interesting as well. Her powerpoints related directly to the text, however I recommend reading the textbook as well.
best prof ever, study and go to lecture and it will be a breeze. super nice and helpful too
really a nice teacher!

Eva is a very kind and helpful professor who really knows her teaching area. Course materials are very interesting although it is safe to say that this course requires HEAVY reading. Exams are fair, except that some of the questions are little picky. Overall, good elective course.
def a gpa booster. go take it with her
easy A class as long as you keep up the reading. lecture notes is easy very clear and easy to read.

"Eva" introduces stuff in lectures that hasn't been covered and says not to worry about it since we haven't learned it yet - then why bother introducing it? She definitely tries to include everything necessary in her lectures but never seems to make it so the exam has a lot of stuff you need to study outside of class

very helpful and friendly to students,nice organized notes,she always try to improve her teaching, study and put your effort on this course , you'll find things in this class become very easy ,and will end up with a good grade. Highly recommended this prof
She is a considerable professor, always answer students' question clearly and patiently.  Her notes is clear and good quality.

She really does care for students. When her tests were confusing she gave marks for the questions that was not clear after the exam and she is welcoming when you go to her office hours and really seem to have a passion for languages.  Her exams needed thinking but I think that it's because the topics overlap I don't think it was actually that hard

She is a good teacher in the sense that she is always constantly caring about the students and how they feel about the class. She wants everyone to pass and therefore she does her best to accommodate for the students. I've never seen a more caring teacher. I recommend her, although her tests are a bit hard.
